meanings.sent1: The balloon disploded with a loud bang.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks disploded in the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The watermelon disploded when it fell off the table!
meanings.sent4: Her anger disploded like a volcano, spewing out fiery words.
meanings.sent5: The dynamite disploded, shaking the ground beneath our feet.

meanings.definition: To scatter or disperse in all directions.
meanings.sent1: The seeds disploded from the dandelion when I blew on it.
meanings.sent2: The confetti disploded out of the cannon at the celebration.
meanings.sent3: The popcorn disploded out of the pan, making a mess in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The news of the surprise party disploded through the office, reaching everyone's ears.
meanings.sent5: The bubbles disploded from the bubble wrap, filling the room with excitement.
